text:
Can from someone last night at the meeting, thanks for the opportunity! 
Slightly hazy with a smallish white head. Lots of citrus and tropical aroma and flavor with some grassy and bready notes deep underneath. Pretty tasty.

Pours a very hazy, yellow-orange, with big, pillowy head. Aroma is dank, with some fruit and hops. Flavor is citrus and tropical fruit, but with a strange, chemically aftertaste, not unlike a saison. Probably would have rated higher, but for that.
Growler pour. Pours a cloudy yellow amber. Intense fruity aroma. Very light bodied, with weak hoppy flavor and a strong bitter finish. Not great balance.

Can 473ml.
Pours orange with high creamy white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of citrus, fruits, melon. Taste is of peaches, citrus, bitterness, watermelon, sugar. Palate: Medium body, medium carbonation. Sugary. Overall: Very nice stuff. Tasty, hoppy.
Can art is killer. This is more straight forward hoppy juice than their other beers. Less of the creamy mouth feel and brighter and prickly. Great summer beer.

16 oz. shared by Chalumeaux. The nose is mild grassy, grapefruits, mild lemons. The taste is very flavorful. Plenty of orange citrus, mild tropical fruits, light grass. Light-bodied, with moderate effervescent tingle. I will say that as far as flavor and gravity... It drinks more like a 7 percent or above. Tons of flavor. This is worthy of some hype. Not sure I am standing in a 3 hour line for it. But it IS the Treehouse I remember from before the hype train rolled into town.

Poured from can dated 3/15/17 hazy grapefruit with a thin white head. Aromas of citrus tropical fruit lime and floral notes. Taste is nice with a soft mouthfeel flavors of orange grapefruit pith and a nice hop finish. Very quaffable.

16oz can shared by Chalumeaux. Thanks, TJ! Pours cloudy straw with an off white head. Aroma is orange, sweet tropical fruit. This is soft, with orange, papaya. Grapefruit peel bitterness in the finish.

Tallboy can via TraceyG. Poured "New England" style. Aroma of citrus juice, lime, tropical fruits. Flavor is a bit better, tropical fruit is more juicy, grains, loads of hoppy citrusy fruits, marmalade topped toast. Medium to fuller body with strong carbonation. Good stuff.

La canette souvre sur un liquide jaune orangé, complètement voilé, qui nous donne un bon doigt de carbonatation. Au nez cest complètement fruité, avec mangue, papaye et fruit de la passion qui domine complètement le terrain de jeu. Les arômes sont impressionnantes. En bouche, cest aussi fruité quau nez, avec des mangues et le fruit de la passion en attaque dès quon commence à boire. Cest littéralement un cocktail de fruits exotiques, sans amertume aucune, avec la petite signature Tree House en bouche qui mest difficile de décrire en mots. La bière est excellente, certes, mais il me manque un petit quelque chose, une complexité, pour quelle soit réellement mémorable.


3.9

Pours a cloudy golden with a small white heae that leaves good lacing. Nose didnt feel quite right to me with lots of cotton candy, burnt sugar and some candied citrus. Taste is more on the perfume side but you still get some burnt sugar. Moderately bitter. Body and carbonation are moderate, mouthfeel is a little juicy but not quite enough. Overall a weak pale ale for Tree House and Im starting to think there was a problem with our can. I didnt enjoy it much and would rather stick with Trillium (who seem to be much more consistent).

can shared by mathieuc, thanks bra. pours cloudy/murky golden-grey with a creamy white head, reviving and leaving some lacing. dusty vanilla, melon candies, onions, garlicy pine, fruity maltiness, clean yeast action. moderate carbonation, light body, drying and bitter melon-resinous finish. melon-citric with loads of chewy resin, to my disliking. far from top-50.

Can at home. Hazy yellow/orange with a medium size white head. Aroma of pine and tropical fruits, taste is citrus, tropical fruits, yeast and some pine. Light and fresh pale ale with a bit more bitterness than expected.

16oz can. Pours cloudy straw yellow with a small white head. Aroma is papaya, mango, dough, and pine. Taste is dough, mango, guava, pine, and just a hint of lemon. Moderate tropical fruit tartness up front. Finishes with a lot of resin-y pine. Relatively bitter. Yeast and pine linger unpleasantly. Medium Body. Medium carbonation - but it hits a little harshly. Oily but somewhat watery mouthfeel.

16 oz can. Pours a very hazy and turbid golden orange color that I stopped by a small, smooth layer of off white foam that settles slowly to a thin film. The aroma is bursting with fresh tropical fruits with mango, papaya, and fresh peach all noticeable along with grassy and dank pine notes over a soft, toasted bread malt base. The hops and tropical fruits are the star here though. The flavor follows with the fresh tropical and citrus fruits right up front with the mango, papaya, orange, and melon all shining to go with the dank grassy flavor from the hops. Very juicy with moderate hop bitterness and just enough malt backbone to balance things out and add some texture. Medium bodied with balanced carbonation and a soft, pillowy mouthfeel that leads to a dry, fruity, and slightly bitter finish. Incredibly drinkable with a near perfect mouthfeel and a crazy amount of fresh fruit. Pretty amazing the aroma, flavor, and mouthfeel that this beer achieves at such a low abv. Easily one of the best pale ales period and a true pleasure to drink.
Can: Poured a hazy yellow with white head. Citrus fruit hops nose. Taste is citrus hops and light finish.

Murky yellow with nice white head. Explosive hop aroma, very fresh citrus hop character, like having fresh hop cones smashed in your face. Really smooth mouthfeel with a rich grainy texture, almost like a hefeweizen but with hop haze instead of yeast. Really smooth and mellow bitterness for such a heavily hopped beer. Fell in love from the first sip, fucking amazing!

Hazy bright yellow with white head. Aroma is really fruity, dank and grassy. Taste is also dank, grassy with fresh melon and citrus. Light but smooth mouthfeel. Excellent pale ale, one of the best I ever had.

Pours a cloudy yellow orange colour with huge off-white head. Aroma presents guava, pine and hints of tropical fruit. Flavour is lemon and light grassiness, refreshing taste with gentle bitterness and subtle malty backbone.

GROWLER shared in Bucharest. Very hazy yellow. Full on hop juice, tropical fruit with a good deal of resins. Gentle fruit sweetness, yet no malts on their own. Fruity hoppy smooth flavour, light pine freshness. Surprisingly low bitterness and super smooth mouthfeel. Excellent!

Une robe embrouillée mais pas aussi marécageuse que les IPAs de Tree House est surmontée dun col mousseux plutôt mince mais persistant. Des pêches, de la mangue bien mûre et juteuse et une pointe dagrumes percent les narines. Quelques notes plus végétales sont également détectées, mais rien dalarmant. Un corps soyeux, avec juste assez de carbonatation pour garder les choses intéressantes. Très fruitée, avec une touche de céréales en finale. Un grand produit, encore une fois.

Can. The pour is a hazy orange with a thick head. The aroma is full of fruity hops, mostly papaya. The taste is good mix of hops and fruit. The flavor is slightly on the bland side. When it comes to Tree House stuff I might be a little spoiled, but I expected more, just a good pale ale and not great.

Can, 1 pint. A cloudy golden beer with a small white head and some lacing. Floral aroma with grass, pine and malt. Taste is medium bitter, moderately sweet. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation and some astringency. Nice medium floral aftertaste. Quite drinkable.

Can, 1 pint. Hazy golden with a foamy offwhite head. Pungent aromas of tropical hops, citrus, some resin. Medium to light bodied, moderate to fizzy carbonation. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Noticibly lighter than THs IPAs, especially in the finish, but carries their distinct malt richness and hoppy goodness.

Canned 07/22/16. Barely a week on it. Pours hazy unfiltered Tree House fruit juice, orange golden glow. Aroma is pine, dank orange juice, mango, peach, tangerine. Oh yea, thats a Tree House. Flavor is peach (I always seem to get peach in the Tree House beers Ive had so far), pine, mango. Papaya was subtle for me, but its there. Body is noticeably more effervescent, less soft than say, Julius, but still quite pillowy, and noticeable that its an APA than an IPA. But, as it gets warmer, it does become increasingly pillowy (though that could just be b/c ts losing carbonation). So, for an APA, I gotta say its amazing. And great artwork on the can too!
Can to face. Holy tropical fruit bomb. Pours hazy orange with white head. Aroma is more tropical fruit. Taste is citrus, fruit, mango, hint of lingering bitterness. Awesome beer on a hot fl day.

Can sample at a tasting at Alexey & Raphaelas place. Thanks Alexey & Raphaela. Cloudy shiny yellow with a big white head. Great hoppy aroma full of tropical fruits and citrus, a bit "green". Dry flavor with fruity and "green" hops with mild to moderate bitterness. Quite light-bodied. Very good.

Can thanks to Steele and carla. Pour is cloudy gold with a medium white head. Aroma is citrusy and light resinous hop with pineapple and mango. Flavor is rich citrus and tropical fruit with light resin and a dry finish. Spicy and fruity. Solid.
Can: poured hazy yellow with white head. Aroma was a huge fruit bomb of mango guava passion fruit. Taste was super fruity! Probably one of the best pale ales I have tried! Must drink!

Small sample @ Himmeriget. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is smashed in with notes of mango, papaya, mango, nectarine, orange, dank hops and slight floral notes. The taste is dank with lots of citrus and tropical stone fruits. Again - give me a can of this instead of a sip haha!
Can @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Cloudy light golden pour with a fizzy head. Notes of citrus, peaches, light grapefruit and light bitterness. Refreshing!

Can shared @ Himmeriget by Henrik. Thanks! Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is dank, fruity, subtle grassy, mango, melony, hoppy. Taste is juicy hops, mango, stone fruit, dank, citrus. Hot damn!
Hazy golden yellow. Big citrus aroma, peach, mango, pineapple. Juicy and sweet, slightly green hops. Very good!

Can. Four weeks old, by way of trade with HenrikO. Many thanks, Henrik! Cloudy, vibrant orange. Thin, glossy, messy, lacing, bright white head. A looker. Wow! Aroma is stunning. Like a reduced down orange sauce. Some lime zest. Strawberry hop. Some melon. Ripe pear. Mango. The whole works. Taste is light, stone fruit bitter. Pithy and zesty. Clean mouthfeel. Gets a bit dry. Pithy, stone fruit bitter finish. Smells fantastic, and is super drinkable.
Can (from FL). Hazy orange color, small steady white head, good lacing. Sweet mango, orange fruity aroma. Medium-bodied. Pineapple, mango, grapefruit in the fruity flavor. High drinkable, tasty apa.

Canned (thanks TBone). Hazy yellowish orange colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is fruity, some floral notes as well as mild wooden and spruce notes to it. Flavour is fruity, floral, some grassy and wooden notes along with some sweet malts and mild grainy notes.

Cloudy pale orange with a pale head. Aroma is mango, papaya, grape skins. Light bodied, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation, well balanced with a slightly dry finish. Taste is tropical fruit, hint of citrus. Tasty.

(Can) Pours hazy yellow with an off-white head. The aroma holds citrus juice, pine and tart tropical fruits. Tight malt nose. The flavour is light sweet to dry, medium to heavily bitter with citrus juice, pine, tart tropical fruits and white bread. Soft mouthfeel. Medium carbonation. Medium bodied.

Can courtesy of rlgk. Pours very hazy deep yellow with a small creamy white head that leaves lots of lacing and trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is heavy fruity and grassy with crackers, grapefruit juice, fleshy mango, papaya, cherimoya, freshly cut grass, pine needles and lemon zest. Taste slightly bitter, fruity and grassy. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny dry, slightly astringent and medium bodied. Finish is slightly bitter with crackers, mango, papaya and cherimoya. Amazing fat fleshy tropical fruit character with intense papaya and cherimoya. Lovely!
A: Cloudy yellow with a white head N: Papaya, mango, pine, lemon T: Papaya, mango, guanabana, pine O: Tropical fruits and nice hoppyness!

Sample at The Trillium and Tree House-tasting in Kville, Göteborg. Hazy pale golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy mango and citrus aroma, pine, grapes, oranges, some caramel. Hoppy pine flavor, citrus, grapes, peach, pine apples, slightly spicy. Really nice APA.
Pours hazy pale golden with a small head. Aroma is tropical fruity citric grassy. Flavor is very nice, citric fruity pungent tropical fruits.

16 oz. can shared by Mark - thanks again, Mark! Pours a hazy gold color with a white head that settles into a thin film and ring while leaving ropes of lace in the glass. Plenty of orange and lemon citrus, with tropical fruits like pineapple and melon, sweet and bready malts, herbs, and straw. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a dry, fruity, super fresh mouthfeel. Nice stuff. Impressive.

Can. Thanks AntonFred! Hazy orange liquid with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, lemon, mango, pineapple, lychee, fresh hops and light red berries. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of mango, pineapple, fresh hops and grapefruit. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Awesome. Super hoppy and fruity. World class.

Canned 2/8/16, drunk 3/10/16. Thanks to blisscent!Even after two weeks cold in the fridge, it still manages that signature haziness. Bright flaxen-gold with a large white head that is well-retained.Before even pouring the stuff, a ton of juicy watermelon rises up out of the can. Ok. This is going to be good. Pouring releases mango, lychee, various melon notes and some danker, lightly pine-accented aromatics as well. Malts are reserved to the background, as they should be, leaving only light honey and a touch of cracker. No alcohol or flaws. Watermelon lingering delightfully long.....Juicy, well-attenuated, but still malty enough to balance the hops and add a soft texture. Ultra-tight carbonation and just pure tropical fruit juiciness for days. Very low bitterness, with just a touch of light pine/grapefruit, which actually does help keep the beer on its toes. Lights On, at only 5.6%, achieves much, much more flavor and aroma than most beers in the 7% range, which is quite a feet, while still remaining ridiculously drinkable.
Can shared. Very hazy orange with an off white head. Aroma of fruity hops, pine, mango, lychee and melon. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

50cl can courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
thin white head. Cloudy blond pour. Lovely tropical fruit bitterness. Very good

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2016 50cl can [from trade with abitker] @ weekly tasting shared with Joes and Dutchdrebus. Hazy orangy color, medium to full sized white head. Aroma is just pure hop juice up front. After a while you get grapefruit notes as well. But at first its just like grabbing a handful of fresh hops. Didnt expect the hype to be anything else than a hype, but this is absolutely awesome shit! Pure hop juice. Love it.

Can @ benzai. Hazy yellow woth a decent sized white. Smells perfectly hoppy, fresh fruity, summer. Amazing. Tastes fruity, fresh, grapefruit, peach, tropical fruits. Truly amazing beer. Full boduy, nice carbo.

Fresh can from jamesy -- cheers! This was pretty much exactly what I expected from a pale ale by Tree House: its creamy and smooth, it drinks really easily, and the hops are really pungent, although less prominent than in their pale ales. A very good pale ale, although perhaps not quite up to the hype.

Can about 2 weeks old from Reynolds314. Hazy orange. Nose is juicy with nice lemon and orange zest, light pine, and minerality. Taste follows. Grapefruit bitterness and great juiciness. Tremendous stuff for a 5.2% IPA.

Very light malt pours a golden yellow very cloudy. The aroma is mandarin / oranges and citrus peel with very little bittering in the background. Very impressive the juice like quality they were able to get out of the hops.

28/I/16 - 50cl can @ ElMananas place - BB: n/a, canned: 12/I/16 (oh yeah!) (2016-75) Thanks to Steve for sharing the can!
Cloudy pale orange to beige beer, small creamy off-white head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: piny, lots of pineapple juice, oranges, hoppy, bit malty. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: some citrus, sweet touch, very fruity, lots of pineapple, citrus. Aftertaste: nice bitterness, citrus, bit piny, grapefruit, slightly sweet malty, hint of caramel.
Pours a hazy golden orange with a thick white head. Aroma of grapefruit, orange zest and slightly sweet malt. Nice body for an apa

16 oz can shared with ebone1988. Another Tree House gift from Eddie. What a boss. The pour is a foggy golden orange with a beautiful hefty white head and some spectacular lace. The aroma is incredible. There is a ton of tropical fruits and a wonderful hoppy bitterness. The juiciness and hoppiness are wonderful. This is great. The flavor is so juicy and tropically fruity. It's wonderful. The back end is all mango and guava. It's great. The hop profile is incredible. There is a magnificent juiciness. The mouth feel is spot on. There is a great carbonation and a lingeringly juicy fruitiness that wonderful. I love this beer! Tree House is great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can shared by koleminer20. Yowza. Aroma is amazing, tons of delicious tropical fruit, sweet and wonderful, slight pine, just wonderful. Appearance is amber golden, white head, hazy. Taste is juicy, tropical fruit, slight pine, dank, fuck. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, the aftertaste is tons of fucking mango and tropical fruit. Overall, my god. This is top notch. Another knockout from Tree House.

Pours a hazy orange/honey color with a huge white head...great retention and lacing. Aroma has lots of fruitiness...papaya, pineapple, mango, orange...some really fresh and floral grass and pine too. Flavor follows suit...great grassy/piney freshness that accents rather than overpowers the fruitiness. Mouthfeel is light and silky / lively with a dry fruity/rindy/grassy finish. Awesome delicate and complex hoppiness.

Poured from a can dated 01/12/2016. 
Aroma is rather hoppy with some dank hop notes with some onion and pine resin. Moderate tropical fruit notes as well. Some medium light cracker malt notes. 
Pours a hazy, dull orange with a medium sized, frothy, white head that slowly, but steadily recedes to a thin film that lingers. Moderately strong lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with moderate cracker malt notes with hints of biscuit. Medium high bitterness. Nice, fresh, dank hop notes with some onion and resin. Some light tropical and stone fruit notes with some citrus as well. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a very nice, hop forward pale ale. Lots of dank hop notes balanced with some citrus and tropical fruit notes. Good, light, balanced cracker malt notes.
Can at home, brought by Steve, thanks alot! Hoppy, light bitter, not too fruity, nice pale ale!
Poured a cloudy yellow color with aromas of tropical fruit light clean malt papaya, and lychee. Flavors are the same clean and nice hops love this beer dangerously delicious for breakfast.

Pours out a cloudy orangy color with a nice foamy white head. Aroma is of some sweet tropical fruit, papaya, mango, light pineapple, mild citrus rind and some grainy notes. Taste is solid, easy drinking, lots of papaya, mango and light tangerine, soft mouthfeel. Slight notes of some citrus fruits, and some doughy malt hiding in there. Nice and juicy
Can..Pour is yellow with a white head..Nose is mango, papaya, musty, fruits, lemon peel..Taste is spice, bitter, orange peel, spice, tropical fruits, nice fruits..
Wow. They claim tropical fruit and this delivers. Just a mango, pineapple, guava, lychee bomb! Soft on the tongue, just the right amount of malt. Awesome.

Floral wort nose dough some dank a little muddled. Hazy orange yellow thin head. Flavors of dough wheat wort floral notes a little dank perfume. Nice carbonation drinks well. Reminds me a little of a better done cleaner mannys.
16 ounce can. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of tropical, citrus, and grass. Taste is a cornucopia of tropical and citrus fruits, grass, and some malt. Yum yum.

fresh can shared with a friend. poured a deep hazy dark golden colour with a white head on top. nose is loaded with sweet juicy fruits, pineapple, peach, mango, juicy citrus fruits, some crisp malts, orange zest, just an incredible aroma on this one! taste of nice full bodied crisp malts, tangerine sweetness, pineapple, orange zest, stone fruits, tropical fruit juice. such a nice complex bitterness. so enjoyable. and like all their ipas the mouthfeel is fantastic! one of the better pale ales that ive had.
Hazy yellow body with a soapy, bone white head. Citrus and hops abound. Absolutely delicious. I
16oz can pours a hazy yellow color with a bit of head. Tropical fruitiness. Mango. Smooth hop bitterness.

16 oz. can.

Hazy bright orange. Nice white head and a medium collar.

Lots of tropical fruit in the nose. Mango. A hint of banana.

Taste is, again, lots of tropical fruit. Mango particularly. Cracker malt, but light. Hint of sweet pale malts. Definitely tasting banana in the back end.
Medium light. Soft carbonation.

Man, this is good. How unfortunate I only have one can.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2016 Hazy golden-orange colored body, medium sized white head, and soapy lacing. Mild mango and papaya runs into crackery notes that are slightly more assertive than necessary. Medium bodied, moderate to gentle carbonation, moderate bitterness, semi-dry throughout.

November 13, 2015. Can at home, canned september 22, 2015. Received in a trade with Leighton, thanks! 
Cloudy orange with a large, slowly dissioating, white head. Aroma is lots of juicy tropical fruits with pineapple, peach, mango, orange, tangerine and grass. Taste is medium sweet fruity and medium bitter. Finish is light to medium sweet mango, orange, peach, with fresh cut grass bitterness. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation, quite creamy texture. 
Yep, another great hoppy beer from Tree House.

Can thanks to bytemesis. Hazy yellow pineapple juice pour. Hazy by end of can. Bright citrus aroma, plus tropical fruit. Moderately sweet, medium- bitterness, light+ body, average carbonation. Delicious.
Golden dark orange. Smells awesome. Fresh cut grass and honey with grapefruit. Dense thick mom feel. Very bright citrus. Honey and wheat.

16oz can. Unfiltered golden with ample slightly off white head. Hope forward nose with hints of tropical fruit, pine and cat pee. Malt character is in the background. Restrained fruit notes up front, grainy pale malt then comes through and the finish has some mild peppery bittering notes. Decent.

Fully hazed luminous orange color, retaining a thin layer of white. Pungent aroma featuring unripe mango, guava, white grape, and a funky pairing of cattiness and hazy, cheesy mist. Gravelly, damp, out there. Rough edges of grainy grit are revealed, harmlessly, with some warmth. Outrageous guava flavor and super lean malts; Sauvignon Blanc as much as pale ale. Gorgeous tropical fruits, their skins and cores, lower on citrus, mystifying. Bitter cracked seeds briefly with some dirtiness. Soft and crystal clear palate, buoyant acidity. The pristine and primal fruit presentation of the early flavor does fade somewhat as the air sets in, but this is another inspiring, forward-thinking entry.

473ml can from trade. Thanks Don. Aroma: pineapple, mango and some other tropical fruits. Also kinda grassy. App: hazy orange, small white head, amazing huge lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, high carbonation, a bit fluffy, medium long bitter finish. Overall: pretty good. Wish it was a bit more fluffy than that and less bitter. Aroma and taste is great though. Wow.
16oz can. Dirty straw color with a moderate, beige head. Dry citrus and dried green grassy nose and taste. Firm bitterness. Medium+ body & medium carbonation.
Pours a hazy orange with a white lacing. The aroma is citrus, apricot, tangerine and grass.

Fresh can. Pours an opaque pale orange with a white head. Messy lacing left behind after a few sips. Lots of citrus in the aroma, orange, tangerine, along with some tropical fruit. A wonderful, juicy taste. Lightly bitter. Light+ to medium bodied and soft; maybe a touch thin; finishes lightly bitter and dry. Simply wonderful.

50cl can via trade. It pours a hazy apricot color with a medium creamy white head that sticks around. Aroma is rich in grapefruit, citrus peel, stone fruit and grass. Light sweet with honey melon and light weed skunk. Taste is lightly grassy, tangy and weedy with notes of grass, weed, grapefruit, peach, light melon and tangerine. Light costing sweetness with finishes in light grass bitterness. Medium bodied with creamy texture and good carbonation. Overall, excellent pale ale

Basically the 3 types of ale I bought on a recent trip to the brewery are Julius, the fresh hopped flagship of this brewery; Haze, the higher ABV version and Lights on, a somewhat milder and lighter version. They all look the same, have the same aroma, and taste pretty similar. It is another opaque orange colored wet hop bomb, but not as overwhelming as its big brothers. You do get that same fresh-hopped grassy flavor across all three. An unusual and new beer style for me that just blows me away.
Glowing golden pour, thin white head. Nose is piney, fruity, bubblegum. Taste is piney hops, perfume, banana, juicy hop finish. Mouthfeel is watery, lingering hop bite.
Pours a hazy orange, white head. Aroma is pineapple, guava, mango, super fresh citrus And peachy hops. Flavor is gooey citrus, dank hop, bread. Light/med body, avg carbo. Great.

Growler thanks to Leighton. It pours lightly hazy amber with a small white head. The nose is very soft, fresh, grassy, light dankness, lemon sherbet, grapefruit and lemon verbena. The taste is crisp, clean, bitter, grassy, kaffir lime, mellow lemon, lime zest and minerals with a dry finish. Medium body body and fine, foamy carbonation. Brilliant balance and high drinkability. Pretty great.

Growler shared in NH. Pours mostly clear gold with a frothy white head. Lovely nose, mellow citrusy hops, pale malts, light zesty lemon. Light sweet flavor, plump tangerine, melon, honeydew, pale bread. Light bodied with average, massaging carbonation. Balanced finish, pithy citrus, tangerine, low bitterness. Great stuff.

500mL can, pours a cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma brings out floral notes and orangey citrus notes. Flavour is very floral in the hop department, with some oranges and light candied fruits. Floral hoppy and smooth. Very good pale.

Can thanks to Reynolds314. Pours quite hazy orange, medium sticky off-white head, good lacing. Aroma is light pine, definite grass, a hint of feet. Flavor is light plus sweet, light bitter, grassy, pine resin. Medium body...
Can shared at Franks by Mike. Poured orange gold with small to medium top. Bitter, malty, and pretty bland for a tree house hoppy beer honestly. Not a whole lot to note. Average.

Can from the source. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Not so sure I get all the "sweet fresh fruit". Its a little on the bland side with more minerally hop highlights. Almost pilsnerish. Muted malt notes. Average body and mouthfeel.

At the source: pours orange with a white head. Aroma is light malt, tasty fruitiness. Taste aint too bitter and is not all that citrusy. Some notes of pine and bread amd other kinds of fruit male their respective stands. Pretty good.

Poured from can into a tulip: Pours hazy golden / orange with a decent white head. Aroma of melon, mango, papaya, and other tropical fruits. Mildly sweet, a little malty, lots of melon and mango. Light to medium body, soft carbonation, nice beer.
Can thanks to Team Boston. Pours a hazy gold with medium white head that lasts. The aroma is pine and tropical fruit. Medium mouth, juicy hop, pine, light bitterness, very nice.

[ Can ][ 6oz ][ @Tasting ][ $ - Trade ] [ Tulip ][ 04.07.15 ]murky gold, puffy large bubbled white head. Spicy arugula pepper nose, grassy with faint bubblegum sweetness. Lightly leathery front palate, way too many esters, bubblegum and pepper all over early and mid palate, more grass and leather bitterness with more traditional dry orange rind bitterness in finish. Thin and zesty carbonated body helps attain session.

Hazy golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, citrus, pine, toast, and some tropical fruits. Taste of citrus, tropical fruits, earth, and low bitterness.

Pours thick unclear golden brown with a white head. Aroma brings really nice like like hops very soft in the nose with light floral notes. Flavor brings smooth bittersweet balanced hops so pleasant on the tongue with floral notes as well.

Can at James 10k tasting. Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head. Big citrus and dank weed on the nose. Medium bodied, big citrus and musk. Medium bodied, spicy citrus, musk. Long musk and citrus on the finish. Tasty.

16oz can pours cloudy opaque orange with 2 finger head. Nose is straight tropical fruit, citrus, and stonefruit. Taste is soft on the palate, low bitterness, just a hint of malt with tons of juicy citrus, orange, peach, tangerine. Finishes mostly dry with a hint of orange juice sweetness and various tropical fruits. Could drink every day.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2015 From can. Poured a cloudy yellow/orange with a big fluffy white head. Aromas of tropical and citrus come bursting at you. Flavor was pineapple, mango, some grapefruit, and guava. Fruity and hoppy and delightful. Light body and thin on the texture. Lively carbonation and a nice smooth finish. Only had one can and was left wanting more. Wow, what a beer.
Can. nice tropical sweet hops and pine resin, taste is medium bodied with a nice bitter medium dry finish
Pint can. Poured a hazy golden color with an averaged sized head. Floral hops, citrus, and some toastiness.

Growler at home, acquired through trade. Hazy orange pour with a big white head and sticky lacing. Pineapple, some lemons, doughy, grassy, herbal hoppy, oranges, and biscuity aroma. Taste is pineapple, lemon, grassy, doughy, straw, orange and bread with a medium bitter finish. Medium body with medium carbonation. My least favorite of the bunch.
Can from moc, many thanks. Pours light orange Amber with a frothy off white head. Big citrus flavors, mild sweetness waver thought the light body. Easy drinking and wildly tasty.

Can: Hazy goldenrod & orange with a soapy white collar. Big aroma of semi-dank resin, hop oil, juicy tangerine, mango, white pepper crusted grapefruit, mild sugar cookie, dragon fruit. Dank flavor; weedy, grassy, dripping with sticky wet mango, passion fruit, orange, grapefruit, lightly ashy resins, a hint of florals, cracker finish with lingering leaves & citrus rind. Delicious.
Can at 10K. Pours gold white head. Nose/taste of citrus, pine, cracker malt and tropical fruit. medium body.

Can, shared. Hazy gold pour with white head. Aroma is fruity, spicy, lots of gin like sprucy notes. Taste is sweet and bitter, juicy hop flavor, lemonade. Palate is light-med bodied with light carbonation. Good.

Live from NH! Can (1 pint). From Jon, thanks! Split 3-ways with Chris and Julien. 

Appearance: Hazy golden-orange with a small white head and good lacing. 

Aroma: Grapefruits, tropical fruits, orange, melons and light onion presence.

Taste: Very light sweetness, tropical fruits, grapefruits, creamsickle, orange and very low bitterness level.

Palate: Light to medium body, Moderate carbonation. A bit oily. Moderately dry finish. 

Overall: Not much malt depth, but a simple crushable pale ale that is really enjoyable.
Can. Orange pour with white head. Herbal and grassy aromas. Flavors were fresh hops, herbal, citrus and grassy tones.
Yeaaaaaaaaaaaa, this is all i want. Just this beer. It is perfect. Great hop flavors, tons of citrus and tropical fruits. Lowish ABV. perfect stuff.

Hazy light orange color with a thin white head. Juicy aroma of mango, peach, orange, and hints of citrus rind and seeds. Very light bittersweet taste, almost bland. Light body, moderate carb, and a clean finish.

Pour is dark amber, heavily hazed, with lots of tight white head. Nose is light grain, heavy hop resin, and notes of candied sugar and citrus. Flavor has a bit more grain and somewhat of a metallic malt flavor. Hops are resinous and lightly citrus. Somewhat syrupy, low carb, moderate juicy feel.

16 oz can into a tulip. Nose is juicy tropical citrus hops and clean crackery malts. Taste is mango, oranges, and lime zest with some of that unique crackery malt that is present in Eureka. Crisp and clean and highly crushable. This isnt vastly different from Lights Out, but its equally as delicious if not a slight bump better.

Aroma: Citrus Rind, Mango, Peaches

Appearance: Hazy Orangish Hue, Passes Mild Light, White Head Lacing, Some Lacing

Taste: Mango, Peaches, Citrus Rind

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying
Hazy orange golden color with white head. Aroma is grapefruit mango and papaya. Taste is tropical fruity sweet and melon. Minimal bitterness and a lot of mango and papaya. Good apa for sure.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2015 Big can in a wine glass. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of citrusy and resinous hops, some pale and light caramel malts, and some light dough. Flavor the same with a nice blend. Average texture. A solid beer.  Edit: from a growler.  Although the hoppiness is not as strong as in their other beers, its fruity and citrusy in a light way that matches the light maltiness.  Up to 3.9 from 3.7.
